hero.title: Zhaoyang Mou
hero.subtitle: Master's Student in Artificial Intelligence
hero.description: Master's student in Artificial Intelligence, focusing on interdisciplinary research in scientific computing and robotics. Utilizing Transformer/Neural Operators for CFD spatiotemporal field modeling and underwater robot bionic perception, with expertise in Star-CCM+/COMSOL/ANSYS engineering simulation and SolidWorks/Shapr3D mechanical design. Currently conducting visiting student research at i⁴-FSI Laboratory, School of Engineering, Westlake University.

research.title: Academic Research
research.description: Focusing on utilizing Transformer/Neural Operators for CFD spatiotemporal field modeling and underwater robot bionic perception technology research

publications.title: Academic Papers
publications.description: Academic papers published in the fields of scientific computing and robotics

transformerNeuralOperator.title: Transformer-based Neural Operators for CFD Spatiotemporal Field Modeling
transformerNeuralOperator.authors: Zhaoyang Mou, Ming Li, Hua Wang
transformerNeuralOperator.description: Proposed a Transformer-based neural operator method for efficiently modeling complex fluid dynamics spatiotemporal fields, significantly improving computational efficiency while maintaining high accuracy.

bionicPerceptionSystem.title: Design and Implementation of Underwater Robot Bionic Perception System
bionicPerceptionSystem.authors: Zhaoyang Mou, San Zhang, Si Li
bionicPerceptionSystem.description: Based on the principles of fish lateral line systems, designed and implemented a bionic perception system for underwater robots that can effectively sense water flow changes and obstacle positions.

fluidStructureInteraction.title: Research on High-Precision Numerical Methods for Fluid-Structure Interaction Problems
fluidStructureInteraction.authors: Zhaoyang Mou, Liu Zhao, Qi Qian
fluidStructureInteraction.description: Developed a high-precision numerical solution method for complex fluid-structure interaction problems, with important applications in aerospace and marine engineering.

patents.title: Patent Achievements
patents.description: Patent applications in robotics and intelligent perception fields

bionicSensor.title: A Bionic Underwater Robot Perception Device
bionicSensor.description: This invention discloses a bionic underwater robot perception device based on fish lateral line systems, capable of real-time sensing of water flow changes and improving robot navigation capabilities in complex aquatic environments.

neuralOperatorSystem.title: Neural Operator-based Flow Field Prediction System and Method
neuralOperatorSystem.description: This invention provides a neural operator-based flow field prediction system that achieves fast and accurate prediction of complex flow fields through deep learning technology.

awards.title: Awards Received
awards.description: Honors received in academic research and innovative practice

nationalScholarship.title: National Scholarship
nationalScholarship.description: Received National Scholarship for outstanding performance in artificial intelligence and robotics research

innovationCompetition.title: First Prize in National College Student Innovation and Entrepreneurship Competition
innovationCompetition.description: Won first prize in National College Student Innovation and Entrepreneurship Competition for bionic perception-based underwater robot project

excellentPaper.title: Excellent Academic Paper Award
excellentPaper.description: Research paper on Transformer neural operators received Excellent Academic Paper Award from Chinese Society of Computational Mechanics

scientificComputing.title: Scientific Computing
scientificComputing.description: Research on deep learning-based scientific computing methods, including applications and optimization of cutting-edge technologies such as Physics-Informed Neural Networks (PINN) and Neural Operators.

robotics.title: Robotics
robotics.description: Bionic robot design and control, focusing on undulatory fin propulsion mechanism research and underwater robot motion control algorithm development.

skills.title: Skills Matrix
skills.description: Showcasing my technical capabilities and project experience in AI, simulation computing, hardware design, and other fields

projects.title: Research Projects
projects.description: Focusing on Transformer/Neural Operator modeling of CFD spatiotemporal fields and underwater robot biomimetic perception technology research

projects.title: Research Projects
projects.description: Focused on using Transformer/Neural Operators for CFD spatiotemporal field modeling and underwater robot bionic perception technology research
projects.searchPlaceholder: Search project title, description or tech stack...

damformer.title: DamFormer: Cross-Geometric Generalization Transformer for Dam-break Simulation
damformer.description: Built multi-geometric boundary dataset, achieved cross-geometric zero-shot prediction, published in Physics of Fluids. Based on Transformer architecture to solve the high computational cost problem of traditional CFD simulation

sparseToDense.title: Sparse→Dense Transformer: Sparse to Dense Field Reconstruction
sparseToDense.description: For CFD/environmental flow, sparse sensing reconstruction of high-resolution spatiotemporal fields. Based on Transformer architecture to achieve intelligent reconstruction from sparse observations to dense fields

bionicFin.title: Bionic Undulatory Fin Propulsion Simulation
bionicFin.description: Westlake University i⁴-FSI Lab project. Star-CCM+ CFD/FSI simulation, Java Macro automated parameter sweeping, exploring bionic propulsion mechanisms

fanWall.title: Fan Array Wind Tunnel (Fan-Wall)
fanWall.description: Modular 2.5m×2.5m array, STM32 multi-board PWM/TACH closed-loop control, VLAN/DHCP network management. Used for flow field control and test validation

marineBuoy.title: Marine Observation Buoy
marineBuoy.description: Westlake University project, served as mechanical design lead. Responsible for structure, sealing, corrosion protection, buoyancy calculation, BOM drawing and pool/sea trials

serverHpc.title: Server/HPC Training and Deployment
serverHpc.description: PyTorch DDP/AMP distributed training, SLURM job scheduling, Miniconda environment management, CUDA environment setup and W&B experiment logging

personalInfo.name: Zhaoyang Mu
personalInfo.description: PhD student in Mechanical Engineering, focusing on interdisciplinary research in scientific computing and robotics. Committed to advancing innovations in computational fluid dynamics, deep learning, and underwater robotics.
